UK Seatbelts Data

Source: R/fastcpd-data.R
uk_seatbelts.Rd

Road Casualties in Great Britain 1969–84.

Usage

uk_seatbelts

Format

uk_seatbelts is a multiple time series, with columns

DriversKilled

car drivers killed.

front

front-seat passengers killed or seriously injured.

rear

rear-seat passengers killed or seriously injured.

kms

distance driven.

PetrolPrice

petrol price.

VanKilled

number of van (‘light goods vehicle’) drivers.

law

0/1: was the law in effect that month?

Source

R package datasets

Examples

result_ar <- fastcpd.ar(
  data = diff(uk_seatbelts[, "drivers"], lag = 12), order = 1
)
summary(result_ar)
#> 
#> Call:
#> fastcpd.ar(data = diff(uk_seatbelts[, "drivers"], lag = 12), 
#>     order = 1)
#> 
#> Change points:
#> 71 158 
#> 
#> Cost values:
#> 1294597 914674.8 310958 
#> 
#> Parameters:
#>   segment 1   segment 2 segment 3
#> 1 0.5543967 -0.07501079 0.7825427
plot(result_ar)


result_lm <- fastcpd.lm(
  diff(uk_seatbelts[, c("drivers", "kms", "PetrolPrice", "law")], lag = 12)
)

cp_dates <- as.Date("1969-01-01", format = "%Y-%m-%d")
cp_dates <- cp_dates + lubridate::period(month = 1 + result_lm@cp_set + 12)
cp_dates <- zoo::as.yearmon(cp_dates)

uk_seatbelts_df <- data.frame(
  dates = zoo::as.yearmon(time(uk_seatbelts)),
  drivers = c(uk_seatbelts[, "drivers"])
)

ggplot2::ggplot() +
  ggplot2::geom_line(
    data = uk_seatbelts_df,
    mapping = ggplot2::aes(x = dates, y = drivers)
  ) +
  ggplot2::geom_vline(
    xintercept = cp_dates,
    linetype = "dashed",
    color = "red"
  ) +
  zoo::scale_x_yearmon() +
  ggplot2::annotate(
    "text",
    x = cp_dates,
    y = 1025,
    label = as.character(cp_dates),
    color = "blue"
  )
